subject: Re: [junit] failed assumption reports as passed instead of ignored
msgSnippet: Stefan, I ve added the issue to our tracker.  Thanks, David Saff
messageBody:
Stefan,

I've added the issue to our tracker. Thanks,

David Saff

On Fri, Jul 10, 2009 at 4:04 PM, Stefan L<stefan_lun@...> wrote:
> Ok, thanks for clarification.
> But how do we proceed to have the expected functionality?
> I don't know what's happening with eclipse but I don't think that anything will be
> changed before it has too.
> Also even if we have the assumptions there working as we want a user doesn't have
> to use them.
> What I'm trying to say is that please implement assumptions for individual
> test cases as the intention for 4.5? was.
>
> Until eclipse behaves nicely don't run them within eclipse but thats a choice for the end user.
>
> br /Stefan
>
>> Failed assumptions _should_ be treated as ignored. Unfortunately, at
>> the time assumptions were released, Eclipse had bad behavior if a test
>> method was first started, and then ignored, so I rolled back this
>> change at the last minute, without updating the documentation. Please
>> remind me until this is fixed.
>
>
>
>      __________________________________________________________
